weekly_top_story.headline: CDC warns of record‑high U.S. flu activity driven by emergent ‘subclade K’ strain
weekly_top_story.summary: The CDC reports the highest level of flu‑related respiratory illness since at least 1997–98, driven by a new ‘subclade K’ strain that has prolonged and intensified flu seasons worldwide, signaling a need for heightened surveillance, vaccination, and surge‑capacity planning for clinicians.[2]
weekly_top_story.source: KFF Health News (summarizing CDC data) / STAT News

stories.headline: Flu continues to bring misery across U.S. as ‘subclade K’ drives highest respiratory illness levels in decades
stories.summary: CDC data show nearly all U.S. states at high or very high flu activity and record levels of outpatient respiratory illness visits, underscoring severe system strain and reinforcing the urgency of vaccination, antivirals, and capacity management for frontline clinicians.[2]

stories.headline: South Carolina measles outbreak grows to 188 cases, largely linked to undervaccinated elementary schools
stories.summary: South Carolina officials report 188 measles cases—185 tied to an Upstate‑region school‑based outbreak with low vaccination rates—prompting quarantines and highlighting the urgent need for clinicians to verify MMR coverage and rapidly recognize potential cases.[2]

stories.headline: Systematic review defines core long‑COVID symptom clusters across neurologic, respiratory, and cardiopulmonary domains
stories.summary: A new systematic review in eClinicalMedicine concludes that long COVID is best characterized as overlapping neurologic, respiratory, olfactory/gustatory, cardiopulmonary, and fatigue symptom clusters, giving clinicians a clearer framework for diagnosis and multidisciplinary management.[2]
